metadata.title: CVE-2014-8412 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) VoIP channel drivers, (2) DUNDi, and (3) Asterisk Manager Interface(AMI) in Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.32.1, 11.x before 11.14.1,12.x before 12.7.1, and 13.x before 13.0.1 and Certified Asterisk 1.8.28before 1.8.28-cert3 and 11.6 before 11.6-cert8 allows remote attackers tobypass the ACL restrictions via a packet with a source IP that does notshare the address family as the first ACL entry.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-tests - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.1.0~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
